Posted By: AmericanVigor (11/30/2010 3:04:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: [Aven Windreader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aven Windreader) and [Hydromorph Gull](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hydromorph Gull) are both almost strictly better, the only thing keeping them from being strictly better is that they have a cost of 3UU instead of 4U. There are numerous cards at a cost of 4U that are also almost strictly better, with the only difference being creature type (which TECHNICALLY prevents a creature from being strictly better than another, even if it doesn't actually happen in games with obscure creature types like Bird). There are also some cards at 2UU which are almost strictly better, with the differences being the creature type and amount of coloured mana in the cost. All in all, a completely outclassed card that's only saved from being strictly worse than many other cards by technicalities.
posts.html:
Aven Windreader and Hydromorph Gull are both almost strictly better, the only thing keeping them from being strictly better is that they have a cost of 3UU instead of 4U. There are numerous cards at a cost of 4U that are also almost strictly better, with the only difference being creature type (which TECHNICALLY prevents a creature from being strictly better than another, even if it doesn't actually happen in games with obscure creature types like Bird). There are also some cards at 2UU which are almost strictly better, with the differences being the creature type and amount of coloured mana in the cost. All in all, a completely outclassed card that's only saved from being strictly worse than many other cards by technicalities.
